page.title: 08Southern Nazeing 2
page.content: Some arable farmers in the area hae also turned some fields to "cash summer crops" such as strawberries where the public are invited to pick their own. This is far cheaper for the public, less outlay for the farmer and a better return for him. Such a field can be found in the Southern part of the area. The other major land use ie gravel extraction, has been carried out for a number of years in this area by Redland Gravel Company, and throughout the centre of our area evidence of this extraction can be seen, such as the artificial lakes. However, as part of the Lee Valley Park policy, the lakes have been turned into leisure facilities when extraction has been completed - frequently on our visits people could be seen whiling away the time fishing in these man-made lakes.
